context: Moreover, in contactors operating co-currently, the Number of Transfer Units is equal to one with a possible saturation of the scrubbing liquid in the absence of VOC degradation after reaching the Height of a Transfer Units (HTU). To increase both the mass transfer kinetics and the absorption capacity, a fast chemical reaction is required to improve mass transfer in the liquid and to consume the targeted VOC (Perry and Green, 1997). Acidic or basic reactions are possible candidates to increase the apparent VOC solubility but this solution is not universal. In a previous paper, the opportunity of using hydroxyl radical HO° as a fast chemical oxidant using the ozone/hydrogen peroxide based advanced oxidation process (AOP) was investigated (Biard et al., 2010). This oxidant is a priori a perfect candidate considering its high reactivity and low selectivity with all the VOCs (Munter, 2001; Lobo and Ried, 2008). However, due to its poor stability, the HO° concentration in water is usually low (in the range 10−10 to 10−12 M) which counterbalances its high reactivity. Consequently, using AOPs, the HO° formation is mostly the rate-limiting step (Beltrán, 1997).
